question: A boat goes 20 km downstream in one hour and the same distance upstream in two hours. The speed of the boat in still water is:
explanation:
Let the speed of boat in still water be x km/hr and the rate of stream be y km/hr.
âˆ´ Downstream rate = (x + y) km/hr
and upstream rate = (x - y) km/hr
$latex Now, \\frac{20}{x + y} = 1&s=1$
$latex => x + y = 20 .......\\left ( 1 \\right )$
$latex and \\frac{20}{x-y} = 2&s=1$
$latex => x - y = 10 .......\\left ( 2 \\right )$
From (1) and (2) we have 
x = 15 km/hr.
Hence option [D] is correct answer.
